captions.text: Wow, you mean I can browse Myspace and YouTube for just £29.99 a month?
Why yes. With Virgin Media, you can.
Sounds kind of stupid doesn't it?
Well, it's not.

You see a few years ago the media "discovered"
the Internet

and since then they've been milking the hell
out of it.
That's why some of the most popular things on YouTube are about the most popular things on YouTube.

But ever since someone overturned the big
metaphorical rock the Internet was hidden under

the big money men that basically decide what
we get to do in our spare time have been thinking.
WAIT! PEOPLE ARE HAVING FUN?! MAKING FRIENDS?! BEING CREATIVE?!
WE SHOULD MAKE THEM PAY TO DO THAT!

To cut a long story short. This basically
means that in a matter of years you're going

to have about as much control of the Internet
as you do over your television.
All the Internet service providers
Those are the people who connect you to the Internet

Will be telling you what websites you're allowed
to go on

and they'll only let you go on the websites
that pay them enough money
Kind of like television

So, that means you'll be paying more to go
on less websites

This means that before long the only websites
left will be

YouTube, Myspace, Facebook, Flickr, Ebay,
Google, Yahoo, Hotmail, Blogger and Wikipedia.
And if that leaves you saying
"But those are the only websites I use"
Then think about this

1. If you ever need to find something out
that isn't already covered by Wikipedia you're
gonna have to read a book.
"Whut?"
2. No more porn
"URGH?!"
Yeah, didn't think about that did you?
You want porn? You're gonna have to pay for it.
"NOOOOOOOOO!!!"

But overall the smaller websites will still
be there. You just won't be able to get to them.

Unless of course they pay your Internet provider
a boat load of cash so that you can go on their website.

And you pay your Internet service provider
a boat load of cash so you can goto the website.

And while you're there you'll probably also
have to pay them a boat load of cash so that

they can pay your Internet service provider
so that you can pay to visit their website.
So, by now you're probably asking
"But Tom! How can I do anything about this?!"
Well,
and let's be honest here.

You're probably quite lazy so you're not actually
gonna want to do anything, but what you can
do is show this video to your friends.
Make your own video about this issue.

Or you could just click the link right here
to find what this is all about and what we
'The Internet' can do to stop it.

Net Neutrality is what makes the Internet
free for us to use.
Let's keep it that way.

Hi, my name is Tom Ridgewell and I just told
you how to do something worthwhile.
Hey! Wait! What was that about porn?!
I like porn?!
Where's the porn?
Porn?
